``` python
class Solution:
    def fourSum(self, nums: List[int], target: int) -> List[List[int]]:
        nums.sort()  # å¯¹æ•°ç»„è¿›è¡Œæ’åºO(log(n))
        result = []
        for i in range(len(nums) - 3):
            if i > 0 and nums[i] == nums[i-1]: continue  # ä¿è¯ä¸å†éå†ä¹‹å‰çš„å€¼
            for j in range(i + 1, len(nums) - 2):
                if j > i + 1 and nums[j] == nums[j-1]: continue  # ä¿è¯ä¸åœ¨éå†ä¹‹å‰çš„å€¼
                k = j + 1
                m = len(nums) - 1
                while k < m:
                    if nums[i] + nums[j] + nums[k] + nums[m] < target:
                        k += 1
                        while nums[k] == nums[k-1] and k < m: k += 1
                    elif nums[i] + nums[j] + nums[k] + nums[m] > target:
                        m -= 1
                        while nums[m] == nums[m+1] and k < m: m -= 1
                    else:
                        result.append([nums[i], nums[j], nums[k], nums[m]])
                        k += 1
                        m -= 1
                        while nums[k] == nums[k-1] and nums[m] == nums[m+1] and k < m: k += 1
        return result
```

# C++

``` cpp
class Solution {
public:
    vector<vector<int>> fourSum(vector<int>& nums, int target) {
        vector<vector<int>> result;
        sort(nums.begin(), nums.end());
        auto last = nums.end();
        for (auto i = nums.begin(); i < last - 3; i++){
            if (i > nums.begin() && *i == *(i-1)) continue;
            if ((long) *i + *(i + 1) + *(i + 2) + *(i + 3) > target) break;  // æœ€å°çš„ä¸‰ä¸ªæ•°éƒ½æ²¡targetå¤§çš„è¯è¿™ä¸ªæ•°ç»„å°±ä¸ä¼šæœ‰äº†
            if ((long) *i + *(last - 1) + *(last - 2) + *(last - 3) < target) continue;  // ç›®å‰è·Œè¿­ä»£å€¼å’Œæœ€å¤§çš„ä¸‰ä¸ªæ•°éƒ½æ²¡æœ‰targetå¤§çš„è¯æ­¤æ¬¡è¿­ä»£å°±ä¸ä¼šæœ‰äº†
            for (auto j = i + 1; j < last - 2; j++){
                if (j > i + 1 && *j == *(j-1)) continue;
                if ((long) *i + *j + *(j + 1) + *(j + 2) > target) break;
                if ((long) *i + *j + *(last - 1) + *(last - 2) < target) continue;
                auto k = j + 1;
                auto m = nums.end() - 1;
                while (k < m){
                    if ((long) *i + *j + *k + *m < target){
                        k++;
                        while (*k == *(k - 1) && k < m) k++;
                    }
                    else if ((long) *i + *j + *k + *m > target){
                        m--;
                        while (*m == *(m + 1) && k < m) m--;
                    }
                    else{
                        result.push_back({*i, *j, *k, *m});
                        k++;
                        m--;
                        while (*k == *(k - 1) && *m == *(m + 1) && k < m) k++;
                    }
                }
            }
        }
        return result;
    }
};
```

# Python

``` python
class Solution:
    def removeElement(self, nums: List[int], val: int) -> int:
        index = 0
        for i in range(len(nums)):
            if nums[i] != val:
                nums[index] = nums[i]
                index += 1
        return index
```

# C++

``` cpp
class Solution {
public:
    int removeElement(vector<int>& nums, int val) {
        int index = 0;
        auto last = nums.end();
        for (auto i = nums.begin(); i < last; i++){
            if (*i != val) nums[index++] = *i;
        }
        return index;
    }
};
```

```python
class Solution:
    def nextPermutation(self, nums: List[int]) -> None:
        """
        Do not return anything, modify nums in-place instead.
        """
        a = []; b=[]
        for i in range(len(nums)-2, -1, -1):
            # æ‰¾a
            if nums[i] < nums[i + 1]:
                a = a + [i, nums[i]]
                break
        if a:      
            for i in range(len(nums)-1, a[0], -1):
                # æ‰¾b
                if nums[i] > a[1]:
                    b = b + [i, nums[i]]
                    break
            nums[a[0]] = b[1]
            nums[b[0]] = a[1]
            nums[a[0]+1:] = sorted(nums[a[0] + 1:])
        else:
            nums.sort()
```

```c++
class Solution {
public:
   void nextPermutation(vector<int>& nums) {
        nextPermutation(nums.begin(), nums.end());
   }

    // æ¨¡æ¿å‡½æ•°BidItç”¨äºå ä½å¦‚vectorï¼Œlistç­‰å¯åŒå‘è·Œæ‰“çš„
    template<typename BidiIt>
    bool nextPermutation(BidiIt first, BidiIt last) {
        const auto rfirst = reverse_iterator<BidiIt>(last);  // åˆ›å»ºåå‘è¿­ä»£å™¨
        const auto rlast = reverse_iterator<BidiIt>(first);

        auto pivot = next(rfirst);
        while (pivot != rlast && *pivot >= *prev(pivot)) ++pivot;
        if (pivot == rlast) {
            reverse(rfirst, rlast);
            return false;
        }  // å½“æ•°ç»„æœ¬èº«ä»¥å…¨éƒ¨é€†åºï¼Œåˆ™ä¸‹ä¸€ä¸ªæ’åˆ—åªéœ€é€†åºå³å¯

        auto change = find_if(rfirst, pivot, [&pivot](const auto& elem) {
            return elem > *pivot;});  // lambdaå‡½æ•°,find_ifå‡½æ•°ç”¨äºæŒ‡å®šæœç´¢èŒƒå›´å’Œæœç´¢æ¡ä»¶
        swap(*change, *pivot);
        reverse(rfirst, pivot);
        return true;
    }

};
```
